sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default ({components, ...props}) => <MDXTag name="wrapper"  components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"creating-and-editing-wiki-pages"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h1" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#creating-and-editing-wiki-pages"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Creating and Editing Wiki Pages`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Before we can make a wiki, we have to know how to do basic edits to a page. You’d be surprised at how many things require special attention to modify on the wiki.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If you’ve ever made your own website before, you may have had to just upload all the relevant files and immediately have a website that you could use. iGEM’s uses `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`MediaWiki`}</MDXTag>{`, which `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`requires`}</MDXTag>{` you to type in the HTML for every individual page. Controversially, a lot of web programmers dislike this model, because it increases complexity if they want to do complex stuff. However, note that using MediaWiki is a godsend for some teams that don’t have any knowledge of web programming. That is why there will likely be `}<MDXTag name="em" components={components} parentName="p">{`no change`}</MDXTag>{` to this structure for years to come.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`For demonstrations, all pages will be a blank page from `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"http://2018.igem.org/Team:Washington"}}>{`Team:Washington’s iGEM Wiki`}</MDXTag>{`. We will also be using Google Chrome as a web browser.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"wiki-page-structure"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#wiki-page-structure"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Wiki page structure`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The iGEM wiki is structured in a very straightforward manner.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`http://[YEAR].igem.org/Team:[TEAM]`}</MDXTag>{` will lead you to the main page of the specified team. Take note that there is `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`NO BACKSLASH`}</MDXTag>{` after `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`[Team]`}</MDXTag>{`. If you have a backslash, it will go to a blank uncreated page. Be `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`very`}</MDXTag>{` careful when modifying your pages that you don't put everything on the page with a backslash after it, or nobody will be able to find your page!`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There are many special pages that the judges take into consideration for determining what medal you will receive at the Jamboree. These pages can be found `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"http://2018.igem.org/Judging/Pages_for_Awards"}}>{`here`}</MDXTag>{`. Read through it. Some pages aren't tied to awards, some are required for evaluation, and some are tied to special awards. One of these pages can be the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Attributions`}</MDXTag>{` page for your team, which follows the link structure `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`http://[YEAR].igem.org/Team:[TEAM]/Attributions`}</MDXTag>{`. `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"editing-existing-pages"}}><MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="h2" props={{"aria-hidden":true,"href":"#editing-existing-pages"}}><MDXTag name="span" components={components} parentName="a" props={{"className":"icon-link"}}>{`#`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>{`Editing existing pages`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`All the special pages noted in the last section will be an existing page for you to work on. Those special pages are outlined in the iGEM page I linked. It's a large page that goes through everything you need to know, but I will paraphrase the important parts. `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The judged page we will be looking at is the Human Practices page. You can see that when you go to it, there will be a box at the top to signify that the judges will be looking at the page. You have to delete this box.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`For all pages, you simply have to follow these steps to modify the page:
1. Be logged in and make sure you are in your team registry (otherwise you won't be allowed to edit the pages)
2. Go to the top bar and find `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`wiki tools`}</MDXTag>{`
3. Hover over that and go to `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`edit page`}</MDXTag>{`
4. Modify the page as you like (Read below for more tips)
5. Click `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`save`}</MDXTag></MDXTag></MDXTag>
